result.execSummary:
The defendant Timmisha S Ferguson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court allowed HUBER release for work, child care or counseling.

miscConds.notes:
Due to the financial instability the COURT waives all costs and surcharges.

**Court set restitution at zero**
Maintain fulltime employment or be enrolled fulltime in school.

Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs successfully completing/successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

timeConds.notes: Complete 20 hours of community service within the first four months of probation.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timmisha S Ferguson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $630.00 entered as ordered by the court on 01/04/16 to pay $75.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 07/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs signed, filed, and forwarded to Clerk of Circuit Court (Room 104CH) for further processing.

*copy to defendant this date*

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Defendant sentenced to serve  90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR. Court allowed HUBER release for work, child care or counseling.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Defendant to complete AODA assessment.
     *   Court set restitution at zero.
     *   Maintain fulltime employment or be enrolled fulltime in school.
     *   No contact with victim.
     *   Complete 20 hours of community service within thefirst four months of probation.
     *   Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.
     *   Due to the financial instability the COURT waives all costs and surcharges.

 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit,received and filed 
.

Defendant Timmisha S Ferguson in court with attorney Jean Marie Kies.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Timmisha S Ferguson in court with attorney Jean M. Kies.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. For reasons stated on the record,   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Timmisha S Ferguson in court with attorney Jean M. Kies.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Pretrial conference held off the record. Court calendar is busy. Case adjourned for plea/sentencing. Defendant will arrive around 2:30 pm on the next court hearing.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Timmisha S Ferguson in court with attorney Jean M. Kies.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference. State still needs to provide discovery and decision about DPA eligibility.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Timmisha S Ferguson in court with attorney Jean M. Kies.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status of counsel. Defense counsel needs to obtain discovery; ADA Brittany Kachingwe is going to inquire with her supervisor about a "second chance" with a DPA.   Court ordered case adjourned for further pretrial conference in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
-Signed by the Court on June 4, 2015;   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Timmisha S Ferguson in court pro-se.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status of counsel.  

Indigency hearing proceeded.  

Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Jean M. Kies to represent the defendant; Attorney Jean M. Kies to be paid at the rate of $60.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing November 1, 2015.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment.  Order signed and filed. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Timmisha S Ferguson in court pro-se.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status of counsel/pre-trial conference on May 7, 2015. Pro-se defendant needs additional time to retain counsel.  Status conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 p.m.

Defendant Timmisha S Ferguson in court pro-se.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference. Defendant needs additional time to address public defender eligibility.   Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel/pre-trial conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Timmisha S Ferguson
Current: 1328 W Greenfield Ave #5, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 03-26-2015)
Prior: 3926 W. Good Hope Road, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Timmisha S Ferguson in court.  Ann R. Lpez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Timmisha S Ferguson not in court.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/12/15 @ 1:30 pm
